page.title: 10THE ARBOR TREE NEAR CLUNBURY
page.content: The{Arbor Tree}is a black oak in the centre of{Aston_on_Clun.}It is not the original tree but it has been there for 250 years. The tree has been decorated with flags every year since 1786, the year John Marston, lord of the manor, married{Mary Carter}of{Sibdon castle. A custom says Mary was so pleased when she saw the tree that she gave money for the ceremony to be repeated every year. Now every year the flags are replaced. As May 29th was declared Royal Oak Day by charter in 1660, the ceremony is held on the last Sunday in May. It is a very colourful ceremony with a procession through the village, the main focus of which is a child bride and groom with attendants and local organisations like the Women's Institute carrying replacement flags to be mounted on poles on the tree.
